summary: The 'No Handouts for Drug Advertisements Act' (S. 1785) aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to disallow deductions for direct-to-consumer advertising expenses of certain prescription drugs. The bill defines 'direct-to-consumer advertising,' outlines exceptions, and specifies 'covered entities' and 'covered drugs.'  The amendment would apply to expenses incurred after the enactment date, in tax years ending after this date.
